arm_group.description: protocol of optimization ALARA protocol of optimization of doses
protocol of optimization Philips usual protocol of optimization of doses

brief_summary.textblock:
Interventional Neuroradiology replaces surgery. This technology requires various exposition
      to X rays : number of X rays photographs, radioscopy, distance between patient and detector,
      speed of acquisition of X-rays photographs, high tension and intensity.

      The manipulator must find the right balance between quality of photographs and dose
      delivered to the patient (optimization).

      Children are particularly exposed to these risks of irradiation (sensitivity to X-rays and
      long life expectancy with risks. So, it is fundamental to optimize the dose delivered during
      the procedures.

      The investigators propose to analyse a study comparing two protocols of optimization of
      doses. The investigators' hypothesis is that the protocol experimented in this trial allows
      less radiation of the children, compared to the usual protocol.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Protocols of Optimization of X Ray Radiations in Pediatric Interventional Neuroradiology
clinical_study.condition: Occlusion or Malformation of a Cerebral Vessel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  malformation or occlusion of a cerebral vessel requiring interventional
             Neuroradiology

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  opposition ot the parent(s) to the participation of their child in the trial and/or
             no social security.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Protocols of Optimization of X Ray Radiations in Pediatric Interventional Neuroradiology

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the average dose per child, according to the protocol

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of X-rays photographs according to the protocol, quality of photographs according to the protocol,

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
